arts.ttl: Reading return to Bottom Meadow- the venue of previous Berks and Bucks glory nights
arts.sum: Reading kickstart their campaign to defend the Berks and Bucks Senior Cup this evening- on the very same ground they lifted the trophy back in May. Over 600 supporters travelled to Bottom Meadow, the home of Bracknell Town and Sandhurst Town, back in May to support Noel Hunt's youngsters. Enjoying a stellar campaign, the Royals finished sixth in PL2 and just days after their 2-1 win over Marlow in the local competition over 3,000 supporters turned out as

arts.ttl: 'We weren't at our best' says Reading boss after Shrewsbury Town draw
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt admitted that his side were 'not at our best' in a 1-1 draw with relegation-threatened Shrewsbury Town. The Royals took the lead in the first half through Jayden Wareham- after Joel Pereira saved John Marquis' penalty- but Taylor Perry deservedly equalised for the Shrews to even the scores. Unable to carve many clear-cut chances, the final whistle was met with boos from the sub-8,000 crowd at the SCL Stadium. Speaking to the media after the game, a third match unbeaten, Hunt said: "We know we weren’t at our best tonight. Decision-making was different to what it was on Saturday. We’re frustrated but it’s a point, we take it and move on. It’s never going to be perfect every weekend, but you can sense the boys’ disappointment. "Maybe our lack of bravery at times to get it down and play, we hooked on too many things we didn’t need to, and we needed the composure to find the out pass. We have shown them a few pictures on the TV, and it looks obvious but when you’re out there it’s a bit different. We had some opportunities in the second half, there was a ball across the box that I expect us to be in to score and these little moments matter when it’s tight and scrappy.

arts.ttl: Reading disappointingly drop points at home to struggling Shrewsbury Town
arts.sum: Reading were held to a deeply disappointing 1-1 draw at home to relegation strugglers Shrewsbury Town, perhaps a tad fortunate to escape with a draw. The Shrews had won their previous two and saw much of the better chances but fell behind to Jayden Wareham's first half goal. Struggling to create anything clear cut and failing to register successive passes for a lot of the evening, it came to nobody's surprise when Taylor Perry deservedly pulled the visitors level early in the second half. Seeing lots of the ball, nothing of note was created in the final third and boos met the full time whistle.

arts.ttl: Reading’s play-off hopes hit as they are held in scrappy Shrewsbury draw
arts.sum: Reading took the lead in the 28th minute through Jayden Wareham, while Taylor Perry levelled 11 minutes after the break for a share of the spoils.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Two changes for visit of Shrewsbury Town as defender drops out
arts.sum: Reading defender Amadou Mbengue makes his first start since January for the visit of Shrewsbury Town, in the place of the injured Harlee Dean. The former Birmingham City captain limped off in Saturday's 0-0 draw at Huddersfield Town and Mbengue came on to preserve the clean sheet. Joel Pereira remains in goal, looking for a third straight clean sheet, while Michael Craig, Mbengue, Tyler Bindon and Andre Garcia complete the back four.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading look to continue play-off push with visit of Shrewsbury
arts.sum: Reading look to continue their push for a play-off spot as Gareth Ainsworth brings his relegation-threatened Shrewsbury Town to Berkshire. The Royals have two clean sheets in a row and four points, while the Shrews have won their last two.

arts.ttl: Wrexham forward nominated for monthly goal award while with Reading
arts.sum: Wrexham forward Sam Smith has been nominated for Goal of the Month while still with Reading. The 26-year-old sealed a £2m move to the Racecourse Ground before last week's deadline and is yet to find the net for the Red Dragons. However, he has 11 League One goals so far this season and his impressive strike against former club Cambridge United has caught the attention of the EFL. Harvey Knibbs had netted a brace already and with the match poised at 2-1, Smith looped Lewis Wing's diagonal pass over the onrushing goalkeeper to seal a 3-1 victory on New Year's Day.

arts.ttl: Fulham FA Cup victory ensures Reading trip to Wigan Athletic remains unchanged
arts.sum: Fulham's 2-1 victory over Wigan Athletic on Saturday ensures Reading will not face a midweek trip to Lancashire next month. The Whites overcame the Latics at the Brick Community Stadium in the FA Cup fourth round while the Royals were being held to a 0-0 draw at Huddersfield Town. While three of the next four fixtures are on home turf at the SCL Stadium, the Royals face a trip to Wigan in March. Set for Saturday, March 1, this match would have been rescheduled for a midweek had Shaun Maloney's side won against Marco Silva's side.

arts.ttl: Reading defender labels Shrewsbury Town clash 'must-win' for play-off chasers
arts.sum: Reading defender Michael Craig has labelled this evening's meeting with Shrewsbury Town 'must-win' if the side are to continue their chase for the play-offs. Craig has been a stalwart for the Royals in the past 18 months, making the right-back berth his own after the long-term injury to captain Andy Yiadom last April. Last season, the Royals battled points deductions and finished 17th, enjoying play-off form despite an atrocious start to life under Ruben Selles. In November 2023, Reading slunk away from Shrewsbury after seeing a two-goal lead slip, including conceding twice in added time, which left them 10 points adrift of safety. By the time Salop returned to Berkshire in February, again winning 3-2, Reading were above the dotted line but were soon to be slapped with another points deduction and were fretting over the possibility of losing Bearwood.

arts.ttl: ‘Next week’ – Hull City in line for injury boost amid latest Ruben Selles update
arts.sum: Hull City boss Ruben Selles has said he expects Kasey Palmer and Charlie Hughes to return to training… The post ‘Next week’ – Hull City in line for injury boost amid latest Ruben Selles update appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
